paragraph.string: The Michigan Department of Health and Human Services is committed to providing quality and evidence-based pharmacy services to behavioral health patients. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Magellan Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence based guidelines are used to identify any potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.
This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation or come to your office to meet with you to discuss how the information can be used to improve the quality of care and reduce the risks of adverse events. You can also use the contact information below to contact a clinical pharmacist to request a personal consultation, provide feedback, ask questions, or request additional data.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

Trish M. Bouck, MPA, RN
Director, Pharmacy Management Division
Bureau of Medicaid Care Management & Quality Assurance
Medical Services Administration
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services cc: Enclosure

paragraph.string: {hotline_name} is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high quality care as we support them in optimizing their medications. Our approach encompasses the management of pharmacy, clinical, behavioral and social healthcare benefits.

In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate and cost-effective care to your patients, we are reaching out as part of our Academic Detailing Program. Through this program, we identify members who may have medication related concerns. These members are flagged through drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific medication improvement opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care. The UnitedHealthcare pharmacy services and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource to support your expertise.
A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects.
Our Academic Detailing Program is here to assist you. You may request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist or 1-844-260-8019.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data. Additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact us at 1-844-260-8019 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.
You met with a pharmacist on {review_date} to review the medications you are taking.

This letter includes your action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and how to use them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other healthcare providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you want to talk about this letter or any of the other materials, you can call {hotline_name} toll-free at {pharmacist_phone}. {hotline_hours} or fax us on {pharmacist_fax}. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.
Re: Whole Health Rx Consultation Program-ALERT

Prime Therapeutics, in partnership with Pennsylvania Department of Health, is committed to providing quality, evidence-based pharmacy services to our members. To collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms centered on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to discuss how this information can be used to support your prescribing decisions, improve quality of care, and reduce the risks of adverse events. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your clinical pharmacist at

The enclosed information is derived from Prime Therapeutics pharmacy claims data with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your NPI.
If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number 1-800-243-3771 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Kristen C, PharmD
Clinical Pharmacist Specialist
Prime Therapeutics

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

default.Spanish: Cómo desechar de manera segura los medicamentos recetados no utilizados

paragraph.string: Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.
¿Cómo se almacenan los medicamentos de manera segura

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave them in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

paragraph.string: How do you dispose of medications safely?

default.Spanish: ¿Cómo puede deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura?

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or have expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

paragraph.string: What drug take back programs are near you?

default.Spanish: ¿Que programas de devolución de medicamentos están cerca de su domicilio?

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
      o       Visit deatakeback.com for information about medication disposal.
      o       Visit bit.ly/3guWP4x for a list medication drop-off locations.

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:

paragraph.string: What other ways can you dispose of medications?

default.Spanish: ¿Qué otras formas hay para deshacerse de los medicamentos?

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your provider or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su proveedor o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your provider or pharmacist.

Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.
Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese a bit.ly/3TmFnO2 para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su proveedor o farmacéutico.

paragraph.string: Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiovascular Disease (SPC) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that this patient is currently not taking a moderate to high intensity statin. The ACC/AHA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol recommends patients < 75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to take a high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. In patients > 75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), it is reasonable to initiate a moderate to high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. This patient has a diagnosis indicating atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD).

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.
Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de manera segura:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

default.Spanish: Cómo deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

text.string: A pharmacist is waiting to speak with you! Get helpful tips from a pharmacist with one call.

default.Spanish: ¡Un farmacéutico está esperando para hablar con usted! Obténga consejos útiles de un farmacéutico con una sola llamada.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your [patient_org.report.reportPlanName] Medicare plan, you are eligible to receive a medication review through our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no extra cost to you to participate.

default.Spanish:
Estimado/a {patient_full_name},

Como parte de su plan de [patient_org.report.reportPlanName] Medicare, usted es elegible para recibir una revisión de sus medicamentos a través de nuestro programa de administración de terapias de medicación, conocido como Medication Therapy Management (MTM). Dado que cumple con los requisitos del programa de acuerdo a la cantidad de medicamentos que toma, el número de condiciones de salud que tiene y el costo anual de sus recetas, ha calificado automáticamente para este importante programa. Este servicio es gratuito.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

You have automatically qualified for the Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program as part of your [patient_org.report.reportPlanName] plan. The program provides a comprehensive review of your medications to help you manage your prescriptions for the best treatment. There is no extra cost to participate.

default.Spanish:
Estimado/a {patient_full_name},

Usted ha calificado automáticamente para el programa de administración de terapias de medicación, conocido como Medication Therapy Management (MTM), como parte de su plan de [patient_org.report.reportPlanName]. El programa ofrece una revisión integral de sus medicamentos para ayudarle a administrar sus recetas para obtener el mejor tratamiento. Este servicio es gratuito.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider

Spanish: Atendiendo cualquier pregunta o problema que tenga sobre sus medicamentos
Atendiendo cualquier inquietud que tenga, como problemas de costo, efectos secundarios o interacciones entre medicamentos
Ofreciendo sugerencias sobre cómo obtener el máximo beneficio de los medicamentos que toma
Ofreciendo orientación sobre temas que debe discutir con su proveedor de salud

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

Una lista de las sugerencias del farmacéutico para revisar con su proveedor de salud
Una lista personal de medicamentos para hacer un seguimiento de los que toma y su propósito

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review, please call 1-855-931-2782 (TTY users should call 711), Monday-Friday, 8am-6pm CST.

default.Spanish: Para agendar su revisión de medicamentos, por favor llame al 1-855-931-2782 (los usuarios de TTY deben llamar al 711), de lunes - viernes, 8 a.m. - 6 p.m., hora  central.

paragraph.string: Don’t wait! Schedule your medication review today.

default.Spanish: ¡No espere! Agende su revisión de medicamentos hoy mismo.

paragraph.string:
Don’t wait! Schedule your medication review today.
You will earn a $25 gift card for completing your medication review. (Max 1 gift card per year). Watch your mail for instructions from InComm Incentives on how to redeem your reward via mail or email. For questions about the gift card, call Medica Member Services at 1-888-347-3630 (TTY 711), 7 days a week, 8am-9pm CST.

default.Spanish:
¡No espere! Agende su revisión de medicamentos hoy.
Recibirá una tarjeta de regalo de $25 por completar su revisión de medicamentos. (Máximo 1 tarjeta de regalo por año). Revise su correo para recibir instrucciones de InComm Incentives sobre cómo canjear su recompensa por correo o correo electrónico. Para preguntas sobre la tarjeta de regalo, llame al 1-888-347-3630 (los usuarios de TTY deben llamar al 711) 7 días a la semana, de 8am a 9pm CST.

paragraph.string:
Andrew R. Behm, Doctor of Pharmacy
Vice President of Pharmacy Services

Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your AllCare Advantage Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review with a myMTMcare pharmacist call {hotline_phone}

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), {hotline_hours}. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an AllCare Advantage member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.
When you complete a review with a myMTMcare pharmacist through our MTM program you will automatically qualify for a gift card in the amount of $15. Here are your choices:

items: fuel-only gift cards (e.g., Chevron, Shell, 76)
coffee-stands (houses) gift cards (e.g., Starbucks, Dutch Bros)
restaurant gift cards (e.g., Chipotle Mexican, Panda Express)
movie theater gift cards (e.g., Cinemark)
home improvement gift cards (e.g., The Home Depot, Lowes)

paragraph.string: After completing your review with a myMTMcare pharmacist, you may qualify for additional gift cards if you are taking certain high blood pressure medications (an angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker), and you fill your prescription for a 100-day supply. Please contact AllCare Advantage at the number below for more information.

If you have any questions or do not want to take part in the AllCare Advantage MTM program, please call AllCare Health Customer Care at 541-471-4106 or toll free at 888-460-0185 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.
Sincerely,

AllCare Advantage

Dear {patient_full_name},

We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help {hotline_name} members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on the safest and most effective medications for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from your medications by making sure you are on the right medications for your specific health conditions. They will work with you and your health care providers to achieve your health goals. The pharmacist can also answer any questions you have about your medications so you can feel more informed.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medications may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medications and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medications.

paragraph.string:
You may receive a call from a pharmacist to talk about your medications. For more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly and take advantage of this free program you can call {hotline_phone} {hotline_hours}.

Sincerely,

{hotline_name}

DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES

This is important information about your Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage. Read this notice carefully. For help, please contact us. Please see ways to contacts us on the last page under “For More Information and Help with This Notice.”
YOUR ACCESS TO CERTAIN PART D DRUGS IS LIMITED

[patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName]’s drug management program helps you use prescription opioids safely. Opioid pain medications can help with certain types of pain, but have serious risks like addiction, overdose, and death. These risks are increased when opioids are obtained from multiple prescribers or pharmacies; when opioids are taken with certain other medications like benzodiazepines (commonly used for anxiety and sleep); and/or when a person taking opioids has a recent history of opioid overdose.

Visit www.hhs.gov/opioids for information about State and Federal public health resources that can help you learn more about opioid medications and how to use them safely. Also visit Medicare’s website about pain management at https://www.medicare.gov/coverage/pain-management.

Who May Request an Appeal?
You, your prescriber, or your representative may request an expedited (fast) or standard appeal. You can name a relative, friend, advocate, attorney, doctor, or someone else to be your representative. Others may already be authorized under State law to be your representative.
There Are Two Kinds of Appeals You Can Request

Expedited (72 hours):You, your prescriber, or your representative can request an expedited (fast) appeal if you or your prescriber believe that your health could be seriously harmed by waiting up to 7 days for a decision. You cannot request an expedited appeal if you are asking us to pay you back for a prescription drug you already received. If your request to expedite is granted, we must give you a decision no later than 72 hours after we get your appeal.

items: If your prescriber asks for an expedited appeal for you, or supports you in asking for one, and indicates that waiting for 7 days could seriously harm your health, we will automatically expedite your appeal.

If you ask for an expedited appeal without support from your prescriber, we will decide if your health requires an expedited appeal. We will notify you if we do not give you an expedited appeal and we will decide your appeal within 7 days.

paragraph.string: Standard (7 days): You, your prescriber, or your representative can request a standard appeal. We must give you a decision no later than 7 days after we get your appeal.

What Do I Include with My Appeal Request?
You should include your name, address, Member number, the reasons for appealing, and any information you’d like us to consider. You may wish to talk with your prescriber about your appeal.

What Happens Next?
If you appeal, we will review your case and give you a decision. If we continue to deny any part of your request related to the limitations that apply to your access to medications, we will automatically send your case to an independent reviewer outside of our plan. If you disagree with that decision, you will have the right to another appeal. You will be notified of your appeal rights if this happens.
FOR MORE INFORMATION AND HELP WITH THIS NOTICE
For more information about the drug management program or any of the information in this notice, please contact [patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] at:
You may also contact one of the organizations listed below for assistance.

items: 1-800-MEDICARE (1-800-633-4227), 24 hours, 7 days a week. TTY users:1-877-486-2048
Medicare Rights Center: 1-888-HMO-9050
State Health Insurance Program National Technical Assistance Center: 877-839-2675

paragraph.string: A review of your medications was completed on {english_cmr_date}. This is done to ensure your medications work well together and help you feel your best.

This letter includes an action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and how to use them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other healthcare providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

default.Chinese: 備註：您的藥物清單和健 康狀況是在 {conversation_date}與您的看 護者{patient_caregiver}討論 的。 討論內容如下：
default.Spanish: NOTA: Se realizó una revisión de sus medicamentos en {conversation_date} con {patient_caregiver} que trabajó para su beneficio. Aqui esta el resumen de esa revisión.
default.Vietnamese: LƯU Ý: Việc xem xét các loại thuốc của bạn đã được thực hiện vào ngày {conversation_date} với {patient_caregiver}, người đã thay mặt bạn thực hiện. Dưới đây là bản tóm tắt của buổi đánh giá thuốc.

text.string: IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) is an HMO plan with a Medicare contract. Enrollment in IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) depends on contract renewal.

default.Chinese: IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) 是一項簽有 Medicare 合約的 HMO 計劃。參保 IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) 需視合約續約情況而定。
default.Spanish: IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) es un plan HMO con contrato de Medicare. La inscripción en IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) depende de la renovación del contrato.
default.Vietnamese: IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) là một chương trình HMO có hợp đồng với Medicare. Việc ghi danh tham gia chương trình IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) phụ thuộc vào việc gia hạn hợp đồng.

text.string: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995, no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless it displays a valid OMB control number. The valid OMB number for this information collection is 0938-1154. The time required to complete this information collection is estimated to average 40 minutes per response, including the time to review instructions, searching existing data resources, gather the data needed, and complete and review the information collection. If you have any comments concerning the accuracy of the time estimate(s) or suggestions for improving this form, please write to: CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850

default.Chinese: 根據 1995 年文書簡化法規定，除非顯示有效的行政管理與預算局 (OMB) 控制編號，否則任何人都不必對資訊收集作出回應。本資訊收集的有效 OMB 編號為 0938-1154。完成本資訊收集所需時間預估每次回應平均 40 分鐘，包括閱讀指示說明、搜尋現有資料資源、收集所需資料，以及完成和 檢查資訊收集所需的時間。如果您對時間預估的準確性有任何意見，或有改善本表格的建議，請寫信至：CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850
default.Spanish: De acuerdo con la Ley de Simplificación de los Procesos Administrativos (Paperwork Reduction Act) de 1995, ninguna persona está obligada a responder a una recopilación de información a menos que esta exhiba un número de control de la Oficina de Gestión y Presupuesto (Office of Management and Budget, OMB) válido. El número de OMB válido para esta recolección de información es 0938-1154. Se calcula que el tiempo que lleva completar esta recopilación de información es de 40 minutos por respuesta, en promedio, incluido el tiempo para revisar las instrucciones, buscar recursos de datos existentes, reunir los datos necesarios y completar y revisar la recopilación de información. Si tiene comentarios sobre el tiempo estimado para completarlo o sugerencias para mejorar este formulario, por favor escriba a: CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850
default.Vietnamese: Theo Đạo luật Giảm Công việc Giấy tờ năm 1995, không người nào phải trả lời một bản thu thập thông tin trừ khi trên bản đó có một số kiểm soát OMB hợp lệ. Số OMB hợp lệ cho việc thu thập thông tin này là 0938-1154. Thời gian cần thiết để hoàn thành việc thu thập thông tin này được ước tính trung bình là 40 phút cho mỗi phản hồi, bao gồm thời gian xem xét hướng dẫn, tìm kiếm các nguồn dữ liệu hiện có, thu thập dữ liệu cần thiết, hoàn thành và xem xét việc thu thập thông tin. Nếu quý vị có bất kỳ nhận xét nào về tính chính xác của ước lượng thời gian hoặc các gợi ý để cải thiện mẫu này, vui lòng gửi thư tới: CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850
Biểu mẫu CMS-10396 (Hết hạn: 12/27)

default.Chinese: 表格批准 OMB 編號 0938-1154
default.Vietnamese: Mẫu Được Phê Duyệt số OMB 0938-1154

paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on {conversation_date}, about your health and medications. As a follow-up to our conversation, I have included two documents:

default.Chinese: ​感​謝​您​於 {cmr_date}, ​與​我​討​論​您​的​健​康​和​藥​物​事​宜。​為​了​跟​進​我​們​的​對​話​內​容，​我​在​此​附​上​兩​份​文​件：
default.Spanish: Gracias por hablar conmigo el {cmr_date} sobre su salud y sus medicamentos. Como seguimiento de nuestra conversación, he incluido dos documentos:
default.Vietnamese: Cảm ơn quý vị vì đã nói chuyện với tôi vào {cmr_date}, về sức khỏe và thuốc của quý vị. Để tiếp nối cuộc trò chuyện của chúng ta, tôi đã gửi kèm theo hai tài liệu:

items: Your Recommended To-Do List has steps you should take to get the best results from your medications.
Your Medication List will help you keep track of your medications and how to take them.

Chinese: 您的 建議行動清單其中列出您應採取的行動，以便透過您的藥物得到最佳治療效果。
您的藥物清單這有助於記錄您的藥物和用藥方式。
Spanish: Su Lista de tareas recomendadas tiene medidas que usted debería tomar para obtener los mejores resultados de sus medicamentos.
Su Lista de medicamentos le ayudará a llevar un registro de sus medicamentos y de cómo tomarlos.
Vietnamese: Danh Sách Việc Cần Làm Được Đề Xuất của quý vị có các bước mà quý vị nên thực hiện để đạt được kết quả tốt nhất từ thuốc của mình.
Danh Sách Thuốc của quý vị sẽ giúp quý vị theo dõi các loại thuốc của quý vị và cách dùng thuốc

text.string: This communication contains confidential and protected health information. It is intended only for the use of the addressee. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately and destroy all copies.

paragraph.string: As part of your Priority Health Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications.
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions.
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take.
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider.
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications.
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider.
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used.

paragraph.string: You won’t need to switch pharmacies to participate in this program, and you can continue to use any Priority Health Medicare network pharmacy to fill your prescriptions.

To complete or schedule your comprehensive medication review, call 833.415.4405 (TTY: 711). We’re available Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Eastern time.

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call 833.415.4405 (TTY: 711). We’re available Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Eastern time. You can also complete and return the attached form to be removed from the program. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain a Priority Health Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.
We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

paragraph.string: As a Priority Health Medicare member, you have access to our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program, at no additional cost to you. This program connects you with a licensed pharmacist for a yearly comprehensive medication review that can help reduce your costs and improve your health.

items: Comprehensive review of your prescription and over-the-counter medications.
Advice to help relieve side effects, including alternative drug options (if available).
A Personal Medication List to keep track of the medications you’re taking and why.

paragraph.string: If you do not wish to participate in our Medication Therapy Management Program, call 833.415.4405 (TTY: 711). We're available Monday through Thursday from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. and Friday from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Eastern time. You can also scan the QR code below, visit bit.ly/4itXTjK or mail the following form to:

Priority Health Medicare
MS 1260
1231 East Beltline Ave NE
Grand Rapids, MI 49525
If we do not hear from you, you may continue to be contacted about the MTM program.
<font fontName = 'arial-unicode-normal'> &#9723 &nbsp </font> Opt out indefinitely* — To re–enroll in the future, please call us at the number listed above.
<font fontName = 'arial-unicode-normal'> &#9723 &nbsp </font> Opt out this calendar year* — You will not be contacted this calendar year, but may be contacted the following year if you are eligible.
A medication review was conducted for your patient(s). Please see the attached recommendations. This service was provided through a clinical program as part of the patient’s prescription drug plan.

Please note: Recommendations are based on limited information. Information available includes medications from claims data and may not reflect current therapies. If we spoke with your patient, additional information was obtained via patient report.

We recognize that pharmacy-claims data do not allow us to fully understand your patient’s goals of therapy, nor do they allow us to fully evaluate every clinical scenario. This information is provided in an effort to help you work with your patient and does not replace your clinical judgment.

To Physicians in New York State: If a prescription was included for your convenience, it does not meet Board of Pharmacy requirements for your state. Please use a serialized, official New York prescription form and fax directly to the patient’s dispensing pharmacy.
To speak with us, please call 1-636-335-5397.

paragraph.string: Provider Communication: Request for Prescription Change or Information

Express Scripts
1 Express Way, St. Louis, MO 63121
Phone: 1-636-335-5397 Fax: 1-833-263-1963
Prescription claims were reviewed for your patient and we would like to bring the following to your attention:

table_items.string: Alert Name: TD - Opioid Case Management - Provider Notification

paragraph.string: Prescription claims indicate your patient may have a history of opioid-related overdose or may be prescribed 90 morphine mg equivalents/day or more of opiates involving multiple prescribers and filled at one or more pharmacy (listed in Table 1 below).

As part of a case management program with your patient’s insurance provider, when there is a history of opioid-related overdose or multiple prescribers are involved, our goal is to verify that there is a consensus among prescribers, and if not, to help facilitate one.

If you are prescribing opioids for this patient, please call us at 1-636-335-5397 or complete the 11 questions on this form and return it via fax to 1-833-263-1963.  If we do not hear from you, we will attempt to call you.  If we are unable to establish through communication with you that the current dosage of opiates is appropriate, medically necessary, and safe for your patient, we may have to inform the beneficiary and deny coverage of some or all of these medications.  Thank you for your assistance in addressing this matter.
1. Are you currently managing this patient’s pain regimen?
2. Does this patient have a diagnosis of cancer and is being treated for active cancer-related pain?
3. Is this patient currently in hospice, palliative care, or end of life care?
4. Does this patient have a diagnosis of sickle cell disease?
5. Is this patient currently in a long-term care facility or a facility for which frequently abused drugs are dispensed for residents through a contract with a single pharmacy?
6. Does this patient have a history of an opioid related overdose?
7. Do you have an opioid treatment agreement in place for this patient?
8. Are you aware that the patient is taking the opiates provided by the prescribers listed in the table below?
9. Will you continue to prescribe opiates for this patient?
10. Do you believe a patient-level opioid limitation through the patient’s insurance is necessary? (For example, the patient’s prescription insurance will only cover specified opioids and/or amounts)
____ Yes, I believe this patient is at risk of misusing their medication(s) and an opioid limitation IS necessary.
If yes, please call us, or we will reach out to you, to discuss implementing a patient level opioid limitation through the patient’s prescription drug benefit.
____ No, the medications detailed below are appropriate and an opioid limitation IS NOT necessary.

11. Do you believe a prescriber or pharmacy lock-in through the patient’s insurance is necessary?                               (For example, the patient’s prescription insurance will only cover opioids filled at a specified pharmacy and/or from a specified prescriber or prescribers)
____ Yes, I believe this patient is at risk of misusing their medication(s) and a lock-in IS necessary.
If yes, please call us, or we will reach out to you, to discuss implementing a prescriber or pharmacy lock-in through the patient’s prescription drug benefit.
____ No, the medications detailed below are appropriate and a lock-in IS NOT necessary.
To implement a medication change, please follow up with your patient. If needed, send a new prescription to your patient's dispensing pharmacy.

SelectHealth is committed to providing quality and evidence-based pharmacy services to your patients. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to better support our providers in their efforts to deliver safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients and members. This program uses drug-utilization algorithms with evidence-based guidelines to identify potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient recommendation(s).
This program is meant to be informative. It is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care.
A clinical pharmacist may contact you to discuss how the following information can be used to improve quality of care and reduce the risk of adverse events.

paragraph.string: Optimizing your medications can help improve your health. That’s why we are working with Arine to offer you a medication management program — at no extra cost — to help ensure you take medications that are safe and effective for your health conditions as prescribed by your doctor.

table_items.string: Better Health — A clinical pharmacist will make sure you are taking the right medications for your health conditions and help you understand how to correctly take all of your medications.

Increased safety — Some medications may cause side effects or may not work well when taken with other medications. A clinical pharmacist will provide tips on how to manage any side effects and make sure your combination of medications is safe.
Lower costs — A clinical pharmacist can look for ways to save you money on your medications and can work with your doctor to find lower cost options when appropriate.

paragraph.string: To get more information or to take advantage of this program at no extra cost, please call toll-free at {hotline_phone}, {hotline_hours}.

{letter_date}

Dear {provider_full_name},

Re: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge (MRP) for {patient_full_name}

This letter is to inform you that a medication reconciliation was completed for your patient, {patient_full_name} ({patient_date_birth}), following discharge on {mrp_discharge_date}. We believe our collaborative effort will optimize and enhance both efficacy and safety of your patient's care.

After you review this summary, it is important to place a copy of this letter in the patient's medical record for your reference and document CPT code 1111F to fulfill quality measures per CMS/HEDIS requirements.

text.string: This communication contains confidential and protected health information. It is intended only for the use of the addressee. If you have received this communication in error, please notify the sender immediately and destroy all copies.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

Thank you for choosing MVP Health Care® (MVP). As part of your {hotline_name} Medicare plan, we're pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. You are automatically qualified for this important program based on the number of medications you take, the health conditions you are living with, and your annual prescription costs. There is no cost to participate.

default.Spanish:
Estimado(a) {patient_full_name},

Gracias por elegir MVP Health Care® (MVP). Como parte de su plan Medicare de MVP, nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro programa de Administración de Terapia de Medicamentos (Medication Therapy Management, MTM). Usted califica automáticamente para este importante programa en función de la cantidad de medicamentos que toma, las afecciones médicas con las que vive y los costos anuales de sus medicamentos recetados. No hay costo por participar.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider

Spanish: Abordar cualquier pregunta o problema que tenga sobre sus medicamentos
Abordar cualquier inquietud que tenga, como problemas de costos, efectos secundarios o interacciones farmacológicas
Brindar consejos sobre cómo obtener el máximo beneficio de los fármacos que toma
Brindar orientación sobre temas para analizar con su proveedor

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A to-do list of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why you take them

Spanish: Acceso a un farmacéutico autorizado que revisará todos sus medicamentos recetados y de venta libre
Una lista de tareas de las recomendaciones del farmacéutico para revisar con su proveedor
Una Lista Personal de medicamentos para llevar un registro de los medicamentos que toma y por qué los toma

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review please call {hotline_phone}, {hotline_hours}. Members can also email RxAdvisor@mvphealthcare.com

default.Spanish: Para programar su revisión integral de medicamentos, llame al {hotline_phone}, de lunes a viernes, de 8:30 am a 5:00 pm, hora del este. Los afiliados también pueden enviar un correo electrónico a RxAdvisor@mvphealthcare.com.

paragraph.string: Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, please call {hotline_phone}. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an {hotline_name} Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

default.Spanish: La participación es opcional. Si no desea participar, llame al {hotline_phone}. Puede continuar recibiendo llamadas durante todo el año hasta que se haya procesado una solicitud formal. Si sigue siendo afiliado de MVP Medicare, puede volver a unirse al programa en cualquier momento. Es posible que se le vuelvan a ofrecer servicios de MTM el próximo año si continúa calificando para el programa.

default.Spanish:

paragraph.string: Presbyterian Health Plan is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients, we have implemented our inforMED Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, and accountability, for patient care. The inforMED pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.
A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects.

The inforMED Program is here to assist you. You may request a personal consultation, provide feedback or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at <u>pharmacyconsultation@magellanhealth.com</u>.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact <u>pharmacyconsultation@magellanhealth.com</u> or your dedicated clinical pharmacist and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Anilla Del Fabbro, M.D., Medical Director
Presbyterian Health Plan Quality Improvement Program

text.string: Health and Wellness or Prevention Information

paragraph.string: {hotline_name} partners with Arine to provide Medication Therapy Management services, and we are happy to inform you that you are eligible for a medication review with a pharmacist. We are offering you the opportunity to review your medications over the telephone with a pharmacist to help make sure you are on the right medications and receiving the best possible care. This service is free of charge. During the review, we will try to answer three main questions:

default.Chinese: {hotline_name} 與 Arine 合作提供藥物治療管理服務，並且我們很高興地通知您，您符合由藥劑師為您執行藥物審查的資格。我們將為您提供一次藥物檢查機會，讓一位藥劑師透過電話對您的藥物進行檢查，以確保您目前服用的藥物適當，並獲得最佳護理。該服務免費提供。在檢查期間，我們將嘗試回答三個主要問題:
default.Spanish: {hotline_name} se asocia con Arine para brindarle servicios para la administración de farmacoterapia, y nos complace informarle que es elegible para una revisión de medicamentos con un farmacéutico. Le ofrecemos la oportunidad de revisar sus medicamentos por teléfono con un farmacéutico para asegurarnos de que tome los medicamentos correctos y reciba la mejor atención posible. Este servicio no tiene costo alguno para usted. En la revisión, se intentarán contestar las siguientes tres preguntas principales:

items: Are you on the best medicines for your medical conditions?
Are the medicines being used correctly?
Are there options for your medicines which will save you money?

Chinese: 您目前是否正在服用最適合您病症的藥物?
用藥方式是否恰當?
是否存在能幫您省錢的替代藥物?
Spanish: ¿Está tomando los medicamentos más apropiados para sus afecciones médicas?
¿Está tomando los medicamentos de forma correcta?
¿Existen otros medicamentos con los que podría ahorrar dinero?

paragraph.string: After the medication review, we will mail you an updated medication list and a recommended to-do list. This information can be shared and used to help you when you talk to your doctors at your next visit. Your doctor will help you decide if our suggestions are right for you.

default.Chinese: 在藥物審查後，我們將向您郵寄更新的藥物清單和建議的待辦事項清單。如果您在下次就診時與您的醫生交談，可以分享這些資訊並用於向您提供幫助。您的醫生將幫助您確定我們的建議是否適合您。
default.Spanish: Después de realizar una revisión de los medicamentos, le enviaremos por correo una lista de medicamentos actualizada y una lista de tareas recomendadas. Puede compartir esta información y usarla cuando hable con sus médicos en la próxima visita. Su médico le ayudará a decidir si nuestras sugerencias son adecuadas para usted.

paragraph.string: There are two ways to let us know if you are interested in speaking with one of our pharmacists:

default.Chinese: 有兩種方法可以告知我們您是否有興趣與我們的其中一位藥劑師交談:
default.Spanish: Hay dos formas de informarnos si le interesa hablar con uno de nuestros farmacéuticos:

items: Please call us at {hotline_phone}. If you use a TTY, call 711. We are available from 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.
Please scan the QR code to fill out a schedule response form

Chinese:
請致電{hotline_phone}聯絡我們。如果您使用聽障專線，請撥打
711。我們的服務時間為:上午 8:00 至下午 5:00, 週一至週五。
請掃描二維碼以填寫日程回覆表
Spanish: Llámenos al {hotline_phone}. Si utiliza TTY, llame al 711. Estamos disponibles de 8:00a.m. a 5:00p.m., de lunes a viernes.
Escanee el código QR para completar un formulario de respuesta de programación.

paragraph.string: To learn more about our Medication Therapy Management Program or to let us know if you want to be removed from the program, please call us at {hotline_phone}. If you use a TTY, call 711. We are available from 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday.

paragraph.string:
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES

This is important information about your Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage. Read this notice carefully. For help, please contact us. Please see methods to contact us on the last page under “For More Information and Help with This Notice.”
NOTICE OF INTENT TO LIMIT YOUR ACCESS TO CERTAIN PART D DRUGS

What Action Do We Intend to Take?
Based on information available at the time of our review, we intend to limit your drug access in the following way(s), unless you provide us with information that changes our decision within 30 days of this notice:

What Is a Drug Management Program?
[patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] has a drug management program to help you use prescription opioids safely. Opioids are a class of drugs that include pain relievers available legally by prescription, such as oxycodone (OxyContin®), hydrocodone (Vicodin®), codeine, morphine, and many others. Opioid pain medications can help with certain types of pain, but have serious risks like addiction, overdose, and death. These risks are increased when opioids are obtained from multiple prescribers or pharmacies; when opioids are taken with certain other medications like benzodiazepines (commonly used for anxiety and sleep); and/or when a person taking opioids has a recent history of opioid overdose. If we determine that your use of prescription opioids is not safe, we may limit your access to them or to other medications like benzodiazepines under our drug management program.

What If I Don’t Agree?
You have the right to give us any information you think is important to our decision about the safety of your medication use.
If you or your prescriber has information you would like us to consider, you can contact us at:

Phone Number: 1-636-335-5397
Fax Number: 1-833-263-1963
Address: 1 Express Way,
St. Louis, MO 63121

Note: We are not allowed to limit your access under the drug management program if you are being treated for cancer-related pain or have sickle cell disease, you’re in hospice or get palliative or end-of-life care, or you live in a long-term care facility. If any of these apply to you or you have any other information you would like us to consider, please contact us within the next 30 days. See options to contact us in the section For More Information and Help with This Notice below.

What Happens Next?
We will review any information you send us. We will also review any new information from your prescriber(s). After we make a decision about whether you are safely using your medications, we will send you another notice within 60 days. You will receive another notice if we decide you’re not at risk and will not limit your access to these drugs. You will also receive another notice if we decide you’re at risk and limit your access to these drugs. This notice will explain how you, your prescriber, or your representative can ask for an appeal and, if you choose to appeal, we will review your case and give you a decision. If we continue to deny any part of your request related to the limitations that apply to your access to medications, we will automatically send your case to an independent reviewer outside of our plan.

Note: If you change to a different Medicare drug plan, we can give your new plan information about  your case and any limitations we place on your drug access under our drug management program. Your new plan may place you in its drug management program as well.

Visit www.hhs.gov/opioids for information about State and Federal public health resources that can help you learn more about opioid medications and how to use them safely, including information about mental health services and other counseling services. Also visit Medicare’s webpage www.medicare.gov/coverage/pain-management for information about Medicare’s coverage of other pain treatments.
FOR MORE INFORMATION AND HELP WITH THIS NOTICE
For more information about the drug management program or any of the information in this notice, please contact [patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] at:
You may also contact one of the organizations listed below for assistance.

items: 1-800-MEDICARE (1-800-633-4227), 24 hours, 7 days a week. TTY users:1-877-486-2048
Medicare Rights Center: 1-888-HMO-9050
State Health Insurance Program National Technical Assistance Center: 877-839-2675

A check for side effects and if your medications are safe to take together.
Help with where and how to get your medications at the best price.

paragraph.string: You can get the best results from your medications by completing the items on this “To-Do List.”

table_items.string: Bring your To-Do List when you go to your doctor. And, share it with your family or caregivers.

default.Spanish: Cómo desechar medicamentos recetados de forma segura
default.Vietnamese: Vứt Bỏ Thuốc Theo Toa Một Cách An Toàn

paragraph.string: Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 安全地儲存藥物及棄置不再需要的藥物可以有效防止藥物傷害，還可以防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de forma segura y desechar adecuadamente los que ya no necesita puede marcar la diferencia en la prevención de intoxicaciones por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.
default.Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Lưu trữ thuốc của quý vị một cách an toàn và vứt bỏ những loại thuốc quý vị không còn cần có thể tạo ra sự khác biệt khi ngăn ngừa tổn thương do thuốc. Điều này cũng có thể ngăn chặn thuốc vào tay người không thích hợp.</font>

default.Spanish: Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de forma segura:
default.Vietnamese: Cách Lưu trữ Thuốc Một cách An toàn:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原始容器中並將蓋子蓋緊。
將您的藥物放在安全的地點，絕對不要將其放在不安全之處，例如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或拿不到的地方。
Spanish: Asegúrese de almacenar sus medicamentos en su envase original y que la tapa esté bien cerrada.
Coloque sus medicamentos en un lugar seguro y nunca los deje en un lugar sin protección, como la encimera de la cocina.
Almacene sus medicamentos en un lugar donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.
Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Hãy chắc chắn rằng thuốc của quý vị được lưu trữ trong hộp đựng ban đầu của chúng và nắp đóng chặt.</font>
<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Đặt thuốc của quý vị ở một nơi an toàn và không bao giờ để nó ở một nơi không an toàn, chẳng hạn như quầy bếp.</font>
<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Lưu trữ thuốc của quý vị nơi trẻ em không thể nhìn thấy hoặc tiếp cận với thuốc.</font>

default.Spanish: Cómo desechar los medicamentos de manera segura:
default.Vietnamese: Cách Vứt Bỏ Thuốc Một Cách An Toàn:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 儘快棄置您不再使用或已過期的藥物。這可防止您和其他人意外服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están caducados lo antes posible. Esto es para evitar que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente los medicamentos que ya no necesita.
Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Vứt bỏ thuốc mà quý vị không còn sử dụng hoặc đã hết hạn càng sớm càng tốt. Điều này sẽ ngăn quý vị và những người khác vô tình dùng thuốc mà quý vị không còn cần nữa.</font>

default.Spanish: Programas de Devolución de Medicamentos Cerca de Usted:
default.Vietnamese: Các Chương Trình Thu Hồi Thuốc Gần Quý Vị:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 棄置未使用之管制藥物的最佳方式是將藥物攜帶至您附近的社區回收地點。
在將您的藥物攜帶至回收地點之前，請使用馬克筆來涂掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號碼。您社區中的兩個藥物回收地點位於：
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar medicamentos controlados que ya no se usan es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución cercanos en su comunidad.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, use un marcador para cubrir su información personal, como su nombre o número de receta médica. Dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad son:
Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Cách ưu tiên vứt bỏ các loại thuốc được kiểm soát không còn sử dụng là mang chúng đến các địa điểm thu hồi cộng đồng gần quý vị.</font>

<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Trước khi mang thuốc của quý vị đến các địa điểm thu hồi, hãy sử dụng bút đánh dấu để che lại bất kỳ thông tin cá nhân nào, chẳng hạn như tên hoặc số toa thuốc của quý vị. Hai địa điểm thu hồi thuốc trong cộng đồng của quý vị là:</font>

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

Chinese: 美國緝毒局 (DEA) 准許民眾使用由藥房或其他棄置地點所提供的包裝袋，將未使用的處方藥郵寄 回藥房和其他授權地點。在郵寄未使用的藥物之前，請先聯絡您當地的藥房。

您所在地區的其他藥物收集地點以及有關藥物棄置的資訊，可瀏覽以下網站：
o       有關藥物回收的資訊：https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收地點： https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Agency, DEA) permite que se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados los medicamentos recetados que no se usan, utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios de desecho de medicamentos. Póngase en contacto con su farmacia antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos que no usa.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección en su área e información sobre el desecho de medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Sitios adicionales de devolución cerca de usted: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Cơ Quan Thực Thi Dược Phẩm Hoa Kỳ (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) cho phép gửi lại các loại thuốc theo toa chưa sử dụng đến nhà thuốc và các địa điểm được ủy quyền khác bằng cách sử dụng các gói được cung cấp tại nhà thuốc hoặc địa điểm vứt bỏ thuốc khác. Liên hệ với nhà thuốc tại địa phương của quý vị trước khi gửi thuốc không sử dụng.</font>

Các địa điểm thu thập thuốc khác trong khu vực của quý vị và thông tin về việc xử lý thuốc có thể được tìm thấy tại các trang web dưới đây:
o       Thông tin liên quan đến việc thu hồi thuốc: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Các địa điểm thu hồi bổ sung gần quý vị: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

default.Vietnamese: Các Cách Khác để Vứt Bỏ Thuốc:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
For additional information on the safe disposal of medications, please contact your local pharmacy, police department, or visit: bit.ly/43wQSds

Chinese: 將藥物從原始容器中取出，並將其與一些不想要的東西混合，例如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可密封的容器中，例如密封袋，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器丟進垃圾桶。
有些處方藥可安全地沖入馬桶。請造訪 <u>bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> 以取得可沖入馬桶之藥物的 清單。
如果您對您的藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
如需有關安全棄置藥物的其他資訊，請聯絡您當地的藥房、警察局，或造訪： <u>bit.ly/43wQSds</u>
Spanish: Saque los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con una sustancia poco agradable, como café molido usado, tierra o arena para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algo que se pueda cerrar bien, como una bolsa Ziploc, para evitar que el medicamento se salga. Después, tire el envase a la basura.
Algunos medicamentos se pueden tirar al inodoro de manera segura. Visite <u>bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener una lista de medicamentos que se pueden tirar al inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, no dude en hablar con su médico o farmacéutico.
Para obtener información adicional sobre el desecho seguro de medicamentos, póngase en contacto con su farmacia local, departamento de policía o visite: <u>bit.ly/43wQSds</u>
Vietnamese: <font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Loại bỏ các loại thuốc khỏi hộp đựng ban đầu của chúng và trộn chúng với một thứ không mong muốn, chẳng hạn như bã cà phê đã qua sử dụng, bụi bẩn hoặc đất trộn phân mèo.</font>
<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Đặt hỗn hợp vào thứ gì đó quý vị có thể đóng lại, chẳng hạn như túi khóa zip, để ngăn thuốc tràn ra. Sau đó vứt hộp đựng vào thùng rác.</font>
<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Một số loại thuốc theo toa có thể được xả bỏ an toàn. Vui lòng truy cập <u>bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> để biết danh sách các loại thuốc có thể xả bỏ xuống bồn cầu.</font>
<font fontname='Arial-Unicode-normal'>Nếu quý vị có bất kỳ thắc mắc nào về thuốc của mình, hãy hỏi bác sĩ hoặc dược sĩ của quý vị.</font>

paragraph.string: A medication review was conducted for your patient(s). Please see the attached recommendations. This service was provided through a clinical program as part of the patient’s prescription drug plan.

Please note: Recommendations are based on limited information. Information available includes medications from claims data and may not reflect current therapies. If we spoke with your patient, additional information was obtained via patient report.

We recognize that pharmacy-claims data do not allow us to fully understand your patient’s goals of therapy, nor do they allow us to fully evaluate every clinical scenario. This information is provided in an effort to help you work with your patient and does not replace your clinical judgment.

To Physicians in New York State: If a prescription was included for your convenience, it does not meet Board of Pharmacy requirements for your state. Please use a serialized, official New York prescription form and fax directly to the patient’s dispensing pharmacy.
To speak with us, please call 1-636-335-5397.

Based on this review, your patient will continue to have these medications covered at this time.

If you have any questions or concerns, or you need additional information for use in your treatment of this patient, please contact us at 1-636-335-5397, Monday through Friday, 10am-6pm Eastern, excluding company holidays.
To implement a medication change, please follow up with your patient. If needed, send a new prescription to your patient's dispensing pharmacy.
Information on this form is protected health information and subject to all privacy and security regulations under HIPAA.

Elderplan is committed to ensuring our members receive high-quality care across the continuum of health services. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy, and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a drug management program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. The program utilizes evidence-based drug utilization algorithms to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

Elderplan pharmacist or a care manager may contact you to schedule a consultation to explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and to help manage potential medication related concerns. You may provide feedback or request additional data by contacting the Elderplan pharmacy department by email at EPPharmacyDepartment@mjhs.org or by fax at 929-275-3223 from 9 am to 5 pm EST, Monday to Friday.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact us by email at EPPharmacyDepartment@mjhs.org or by fax at 929-275-3223 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

We’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program, a part of your Healthfirst Medicare Advantage plan. You’ve automatically qualified for this program based on the number of medications you take for your various health conditions. There is no cost to participate. One of our pharmacists will call you in the next few weeks. They’ll have a list of your prescription medications and can easily review them with you and answer any questions.

default.Chinese:
親愛的 {patient_full_name}:

我們誠邀您加入我們的治療用藥管理(Medication Therapy Management，簡稱MTM) 計劃，這是第一保健老人醫療保險Medicare Advantage計劃的一部份。基於您因多種健康狀況而使用的藥物種類數量，您自動符合該計劃的資格。參加該計劃是免費的。我們的藥劑師將在接下來的幾週內致電您。藥劑師有您處方藥物的列表，能與您一同審查藥物並回答任何疑問。
default.Spanish:
Estimado(a) {patient_full_name},

Nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro programa de manejo de terapias con medicamentos (MTM), una parte de su plan Medicare Advantage. Usted califica automáticamente para este programa por la cantidad de medicamentos que toma para sus diversas afecciones de salud. Participar no tiene costo. Nuestro personal de farmacia le llamará en las próximas semanas. El personal de farmacia tendrá una lista de sus medicamentos recetados y fácilmente podrán revisarlos con usted y responder cualquier pregunta.

default.Chinese: 治療用藥管理對您有何幫助？
default.Spanish: ¿Qué puede hacer por usted el programa MTM?

items: Address any questions about or problems with your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost concerns, side effects, or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the medications you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider

Chinese: 解決藥物相關疑問或問題
解決您的疑慮，例如費用問題、副作用或藥物相互作用
在如何充分利用您使用的藥物方面提供建議
在與服務提供者討論的主題方面提供指導
Spanish: Responder sus preguntas y abordar cualquier problema en relación con sus medicamentos
Abordar cualquier inquietud que usted tenga, como las preocupaciones sobre costos, efectos secundarios o interacciones entre medicamentos
Proporcionar consejos sobre cómo obtener el máximo beneficio de los medicamentos que toma

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider

paragraph.string: Statin Use in Persons with Diabetes (SUPD) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that the patient below is currently not on a statin medication. As you know, it is recommended for patients with diabetes aged 40-75 years without atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to be started on a moderate-intensity statin for primary prevention. For secondary prevention, patients of all ages with diabetes and ASCVD are recommended to be on a high-intensity statin.

Action Requested:
Please review the information provided. Indicate the appropriate action items and fax us the form at {hotline_fax}.

items: Patient is a candidate for statin therapy; I will send a new statin prescription to the patient’s preferred pharmacy:

{pharmacy_street}
{pharmacy_city_state_zip}
{pharmacy_phone}

paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on {cmr_date} about your health and medications.

This letter includes an action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and how to use them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you want to talk about this letter or any of the other materials, call {hotline_name} toll free at {hotline_phone} (TTY: 711) {hotline_hours}. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.

Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your iCare Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review call {hotline_phone}

Don’t want to participate?

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), seven days a week from 9:00 a.m. CST to 7:00 p.m. CST, Monday through Sunday. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an iCare Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Sincerely,

iCare
