paragraph.string: Please leave any other comments here about the recommendations or important notes about the patient’s health and fax us the form at 1 (714) 560-7627. We appreciate working with you to provide high quality healthcare for our patients.

DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES

This is important information about your Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage. Read this notice carefully. For help, please contact us. Please see ways to contacts us on the last page under “For More Information and Help with This Notice.”
YOUR ACCESS TO CERTAIN PART D DRUGS IS LIMITED

[patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName]’s drug management program helps you use prescription opioids safely. Opioid pain medications can help with certain types of pain, but have serious risks like addiction, overdose, and death. These risks are increased when opioids are obtained from multiple prescribers or pharmacies; when opioids are taken with certain other medications like benzodiazepines (commonly used for anxiety and sleep); and/or when a person taking opioids has a recent history of opioid overdose.

Visit www.hhs.gov/opioids for information about State and Federal public health resources that can help you learn more about opioid medications and how to use them safely. Also visit Medicare’s website about pain management at https://www.medicare.gov/coverage/pain-management.

Who May Request an Appeal?
You, your prescriber, or your representative may request an expedited (fast) or standard appeal. You can name a relative, friend, advocate, attorney, doctor, or someone else to be your representative. Others may already be authorized under State law to be your representative.
There Are Two Kinds of Appeals You Can Request

Expedited (72 hours):You, your prescriber, or your representative can request an expedited (fast) appeal if you or your prescriber believe that your health could be seriously harmed by waiting up to 7 days for a decision. You cannot request an expedited appeal if you are asking us to pay you back for a prescription drug you already received. If your request to expedite is granted, we must give you a decision no later than 72 hours after we get your appeal.

items: If your prescriber asks for an expedited appeal for you, or supports you in asking for one, and indicates that waiting for 7 days could seriously harm your health, we will automatically expedite your appeal.

If you ask for an expedited appeal without support from your prescriber, we will decide if your health requires an expedited appeal. We will notify you if we do not give you an expedited appeal and we will decide your appeal within 7 days.

paragraph.string: Standard (7 days): You, your prescriber, or your representative can request a standard appeal. We must give you a decision no later than 7 days after we get your appeal.

What Do I Include with My Appeal Request?
You should include your name, address, Member number, the reasons for appealing, and any information you’d like us to consider. You may wish to talk with your prescriber about your appeal.

What Happens Next?
If you appeal, we will review your case and give you a decision. If we continue to deny any part of your request related to the limitations that apply to your access to medications, we will automatically send your case to an independent reviewer outside of our plan. If you disagree with that decision, you will have the right to another appeal. You will be notified of your appeal rights if this happens.
FOR MORE INFORMATION AND HELP WITH THIS NOTICE
For more information about the drug management program or any of the information in this notice, please contact [patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] at:
You may also contact one of the organizations listed below for assistance.

items: 1-800-MEDICARE (1-800-633-4227), 24 hours, 7 days a week. TTY users:1-877-486-2048
Medicare Rights Center: 1-888-HMO-9050
State Health Insurance Program National Technical Assistance Center: 877-839-2675

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.

paragraph.string: Prime Therapeutics, in partnership with Idaho Department of Health and Welfare, is committed to providing quality, evidence-based pharmacy services to our members. To collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms centered on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to discuss how this information can be used to support your prescribing decisions, improve quality of care, and reduce the risks of adverse events. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your clinical pharmacist at:

The enclosed information is derived from Prime Therapeutics pharmacy claims data with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your NPI.
If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number (800)-243-3771 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Kristen C, PharmD
Clinical Pharmacist Specialist
Prime Therapeutics

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help {hotline_name} members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from you and your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medicines and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

paragraph.string: Take advantage of this program at no extra cost by calling for more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly toll-free at {hotline_phone}, {hotline_hours}.
Kaiser Foundation Health Plan of Washington

text.string:
Kaiser Foundation Health Plan of Washington
Pharmacy Administration - RCA-B2N-12
{org_address}
University Health Partners is an independent company providing Medication Therapy Management Program services on behalf of HMSA.

paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on {cmr_date} about your health and medications.

Enclosed with this letter is a Medication Action Plan and a Personal Medication List that we've completed for you. The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and use them the right way.

Here's how to make the best use of the action plan and list:

items: Take them with you when you see your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
If you're admitted to the hospital, take your medication list with you.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you have questions about this letter or any of the materials, call University Health Partners at {hotline_phone} {hotline_hours}. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.

paragraph.string: Molina Healthcare is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at (855) 658-0918, TTY: 711.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our toll-free number at (855) 658-0918, TTY: 711 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.
On Behalf of Molina Healthcare Clinical Pharmacy Services
Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) Program

Blue Shield of California (Blue Shield) is committed to ensuring that our members receive integrated and high-quality care. As part of our Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) program, drug utilization algorithms built on evidence-based guidelines were used to identify potential drug-related concerns, quality care gaps and other healthcare opportunities for your patients with Blue Shield health plan coverage.

Based on our records, we have identified quality opportunities for one or more patients under your care. Please review the information for each patient to determine if intervention is clinically appropriate, then, take steps, if necessary. A Blue Shield clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to further review the identified opportunities and offer support.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data. Claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact Blue Shield of California Pharmacy Services at 1-800- 535-9481 and destroy the inaccurate information in a confidential manner.

Clinical Pharmacy Team
Blue Shield of California
Phone: 1-800-535-9481

paragraph.string: Re: Whole Health Rx Consultation Program-ALERT

Prime Therapeutics, in partnership with Connecticut Department of Public Health, is committed to providing quality, evidence-based pharmacy services to our members. To collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms centered on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify potential drug therapy concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the clinical information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, or accountability for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to discuss how this information can be used to support your prescribing decisions, improve quality of care, and reduce the risks of adverse events. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your clinical pharmacist at

The enclosed information is derived from Prime Therapeutics pharmacy claims data with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your NPI.
If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number 1-800-243-3771 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Kristen C, PharmD
Clinical Pharmacist Specialist
Prime Therapeutics

text.string:
Prime Therapeutics
Whole Health Rx Consultation Program
2900 Ames Crossing Road Eagan, MN 55121

paragraph.string: Providing accessible and high-quality care for you is our priority. Because you’re a valued patient, we want to let you know that as part of your Stay Well Care Plan a review of your medications was done on {cmr_date}.

As part of this review, we are including in this letter your Medication Action Plan which has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. We have also included your Personal Medication List which will help you keep track of your medications and how to take them. Here are some recommendations on how to use them going forward.

items: Have your medication action plan and personal medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, APPs, pharmacists, and any other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
Take your personal medication list with you if you go to the hospital and ask to have it updated with any changes before you leave.
Consider sharing a copy of your medication action plan and personal medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you have any questions, you can call {hotline_name} at {pharmacist_phone} {hotline_hours} at anytime. We thank you for trusting us with your care and look forward to seeing you soon.

paragraph.string: A medication review was conducted for your patient(s). Please see the attached recommendations. This service was provided through a clinical program as part of the patient’s prescription drug plan.

Please note: Recommendations are based on limited information. Information available includes medications from claims data and may not reflect current therapies. If we spoke with your patient, additional information was obtained via patient report.

We recognize that pharmacy-claims data do not allow us to fully understand your patient’s goals of therapy, nor do they allow us to fully evaluate every clinical scenario. This information is provided in an effort to help you work with your patient and does not replace your clinical judgment.

To Physicians in New York State: If a prescription was included for your convenience, it does not meet Board of Pharmacy requirements for your state. Please use a serialized, official New York prescription form and fax directly to the patient’s dispensing pharmacy.
To speak with us, please call 1-636-335-5397.

table_items.string: Information on the attached page(s) is protected health information and subject to all privacy and security regulations under HIPAA.

Confidentiality Notice: This fax transmission contains confidential information belonging to the sender that is legally privileged and should not be seen by unauthorized persons. This information is intended for the use of the individual or entity named above. The authorized recipient of this information is prohibited from disclosing this information to any other party. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any disclosure, copying, distribution or action taken in reliance on the contents of this document is strictly prohibited. If you have received this fax in error, please notify the sender immediately to arrange the return of this document.

Express Scripts

Your patient has also been notified by a letter sent on {report_parameters__variables__lock_in_free_text_letter_send__value} of this review and the associated limitation decision.  You or your patient may appeal this decision by calling {report_parameters__variables__lock_in_free_text_health_plan_phone_number__value}.

If you have any questions or concerns, or you need additional information for use in your treatment of this patient, please contact us at 1-636-335-5397, Monday through Friday, 10am-6pm Eastern, excluding company holidays.
To implement a medication change, please follow up with your patient. If needed, send a new prescription to your patient's dispensing pharmacy.

text.string: Health and wellness or prevention information.

paragraph.string: Magellan Healthcare is committed to ensuring that our members receive integrated and high quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Magellan Healthcare Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence based guidelines, are utilized in order to identify any potential concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding member to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, and accountability, for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.
A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects.

The Whole Health Rx Program is here to assist you. You may request a personal consultation, provide feedback or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at pharmacyconsultation@magellanhealth.com or 1-800-424-4098.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data, however additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number 1-800-424-4098 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Caroline Carney, MD, MSc, FAPM, CPHQ
Chief Medical Officer
Magellan Health
Re: Stay Well Care Plan Medication Opportunity

Village Medical™ is committed to making sure our patients receive accessible and high-quality care. To help achieve this, we have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate and cost-effective care to your patients. Part of this program includes using drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines to identify any potential medication-related concerns for your patients

You are receiving this letter because we have identified quality opportunities for some of your patients. We ask you to please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to decide if a change in therapy can be made.

One of our clinical pharmacists may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information enclosed can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at <<<mistql:@.insuranceOrg.practiceGroupNameMapping[@.patient.practiceGroup.practiceGroupName].English.providerPhone#4zcsPb-80GBzQydP2-KiY-w8VVA>>>.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with you at the DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our toll-free number at <<<mistql:@.insuranceOrg.practiceGroupNameMapping[@.patient.practiceGroup.practiceGroupName].English.providerPhone#4zcsPb-80GBzQydP2-KiY-w8VVA>>> and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

VMD Clinical Pharmacy Team
Village Medical Quality Improvement Program

paragraph.string: The statin therapy for patients with cardiovascular disease (SPC) Star Ratings measure requires males ages 21 to 75 and females ages 40 to 75 with a history of clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to be on moderate- or high-intensity statin therapy. We have reviewed our records and noticed that this patient is currently not taking a moderate- or high-intensity statin and has a diagnosis indicating ASCVD.

Action Requested:
Please indicate the appropriate action items and fax us the form at {hotline_fax}. Please call 833-203-0051 with any questions.

Action Requested:
Please indicate the appropriate action items and fax us the form at {hotline_fax}. Please call {hotline_phone} with any questions.

I will discuss statin therapy during the patient’s next appointment on ______________ (date)
Patient does not have ASCVD
Patient has refused statin therapy in the past

Patient is already on a statin. Please indicate what statin the patient is currently on below:

_________________________________________________

Statin therapy is not appropriate for the patient at this time due to meeting one or more of the following criteria. Please select all that apply and submit a non-chargeable claim code using the appropriate ICD-10 codes. Codes must be updated each measure year to ensure your patient is appropriately excluded.

To properly document this exclusion, please select one of the following actions:
I will submit a corrected claim with the appropriate exclusion ICD-10 code
• Must include current year date of service
• Must be submitted annually with current year date of service
I will fax patient chart notes as supporting documentation
• Chart notes indicating MYALGIA and RHABDOMYOLYSIS can be from any year. All other chart notes must be from this measurement year.
• Must clearly document why statin therapy is contraindicated/inappropriate

paragraph.string: H- Hydrophilic L -Lipophilic; if myalgia occurs on a lipophilic statin despite dose reductions, it may be prudent to attempt a trial of a hydrophilic statin.

text.string: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995, no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless it displays a valid OMB control number. The valid OMB number for this information collection is 0938-1154. The time required to complete this information collection is estimated to average 40 minutes per response, including the time to review instructions, searching existing data resources, gather the data needed, and complete and review the information collection. If you have any comments concerning the accuracy of the time estimate(s) or suggestions for improving this form, please write to: CMS, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, 7500 Security Boulevard, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850

default.Spanish: De conformidad con la Ley de reducción de los trámites burocráticos de 1995, nadie estará obligado a responder a una solicitud de información a menos que se identifique con un número de control válido de la Oficina de Administración y Presupuesto. El número de control válido de la Oficina de Administración y Presupuesto para esta recolección de información es 0938-1154. El tiempo necesario para completar esta solicitud es en promedio, 40 minutos incluido el tiempo necesario para revisar las instrucciones, buscar en las fuentes de datos existentes, seleccionar los datos necesarios y completarla. priority_health.English:
Patient’s Medication Summary

Name: {patient_full_name} (DOB: {patient_date_birth})

paragraph.string: On {letter_date}, I spoke with your patient to perform a comprehensive medication review (CMR). I have summarized the list of medications discussed with the patient in the below table. Please call {hotline_phone} with any questions.

table_footer.string: Please note: this list includes patient-reported information. Please verify this list for accuracy.

text.string: VIVA HEALTH complies with applicable Federal civil rights laws and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, disability, or sex. ATENCIÓN: si habla español, tiene a su disposición servicios gratuitos de asistencia lingüística. Llame al 1-800-633-1542 (TTY: 711). 注意：如果您使 用繁體中文，您可以免費獲得語言援助服務. 請致電 1-800-633-1542 (TTY: 711).

paragraph.string: Your {hotline_name} pharmacy team cares about you. We want to help you stay as safe and healthy as you can. One way we do that is by making sure the drugs your provider prescribes are working well with any over-the-counter drugs, vitamins, or supplements you may be taking.

We’ve partnered with Arine to offer the Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program to select members. You qualify for this program based on the number of drugs you are prescribed, your health conditions, and your yearly drug costs. There is no cost to you to participate the MTM program.
What can the MTM program do for you?
The MTM program connects you with a specially trained pharmacist or nurse to talk about the medicines you take. The MTM program will offer you an opportunity to…

items: Go over your current list of drugs to see how your prescription and over-the-counter drugs, vitamins, and supplements may affect each other
Ask if any of the drugs you take make you feel bad. If they do, you can talk about other drugs that may work better for you or things you can do to feel better.
Talk about the best way to take each of your drugs so they help you the most
Show you ways to help lower your prescription drug costs

paragraph.string: What do you get for participating in the MTM program?

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist or nurse who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A full list of all prescription drugs and over-the-counter items you are taking that you can share with all your providers the next time you see them

paragraph.string: To set up your full medication review call 1-833-282-5783.

We think joining this program will help you stay as healthy as possible, but if you do not wish to join, call 1-833-282-5783 or call {hotline_name} Member Service toll-free at 1-800-633-1542. TTY users, dial 711. They can take your call 7 days a week, 8am - 8pm, October 1 - March 31. From April 1 - September 30, they are open Monday - Friday, 8am - 8pm.
We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

paragraph.string: Alohacare is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 808-973-7418

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our toll-free number at 808-973-7418 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Hanh Bannister, Pharm.D., MBA
Alohacare Quality Improvement Program

As part of your Prominence Health plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at 1- 844-387-1839 (TTY users should call 711), from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. PST, Monday through Friday. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain a Prominence Health Plan member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Sincerely,

Prominence Health Plan

We’re offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help Asuris Northwest Health members like you improve your health. You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure you’re taking the right combination of medicines and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

text.string: Health and Wellness or Prevention Information

paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on @@@cmr_date@@@ about your health and medications.

Enclosed with this letter is a Medication Action Plan and a Personal Medication List that we've completed for you. The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and use them the right way.
Here's how to make the best use of the action plan and list:

items: Take them with you when you see your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list at every visit.
If you're admitted to the hospital, take your medication list with you.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you have questions about this letter or any of the materials, call University Health Partners at @@@hotline_phone@@@ @@@hotline_hours@@@. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.

text.string: University Health Partners is an independent company providing Medication Therapy Management Program services on behalf of HMSA.

Offices also located on

paragraph.string: Re: Magellan Healthcare Whole Health Rx Consultation Program-ALERT

Magellan Healthcare is committed to ensuring that our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. In an effort to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to your patients, we have implemented the Magellan Healthcare Whole Health Rx Consultation Program. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines, are utilized in order to identify any potential concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding member to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

This program is informational in nature and is not intended to replace your authority, responsibility, and accountability, for patient care. The Whole Health Rx pharmacist and consultations are not a substitute for your professional judgment, but rather a resource and enhancement to your expertise.
A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects.

The Whole Health Rx Program is here to assist you. You may request a personal consultation, provide feedback or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at pharmacyconsultation@magellanhealth.com or 1-800-424-4098.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data, however additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact the Whole Health Rx toll free number 1-800-424-4098 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Healthfirst is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. The intent of this program is to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

You are receiving this letter because we have identified specific deprescribing opportunities for Healthfirst members under your care. The identified members appear to be taking medications that may be duplicative or potentially inappropriate based on their medical conditions. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if it is clinically appropriate to discontinue any of the medications. Please contact the patient as needed with further actions.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-844-450-5721.

All enclosed information is derived from Healthfirst claims data. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please call our toll-free number at 1-844-450-5721 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.
Thank you for your continued care of our members.

Daniel Halevy, M.D., FASN, CPC-A
Vice President, Senior Medical Director
Healthfirst Quality Improvement Program

We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

paragraph.string: We are offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help United Healthcare members like you improve your health. You have been selected for this program to make sure you are on safe and effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
Better Health
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve great benefit from your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

Increased safety
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure that you are taking the right combination of medicines and also provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

Lower costs
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

paragraph.string: Take advantage of this program at no extra cost by calling for more information or to speak to a pharmacist directly toll-free at 1-800-XXX-XXXX any time M-F from 8a-6p CT.
You can get the best results from your medications by completing the items on this “To-Do List.”

table_items.string: Bring your To-Do List when you go to your doctor. And, share it with your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: Provider Communication: Request for Prescription Change or Information

Express Scripts
1 Express Way, St. Louis, MO 63121
Phone: 1-636-335-5397 Fax: 1-833-263-1963
Prescription claims were reviewed for your patient and we would like to bring the following to your attention:

table_items.string: Alert Name: TD - POT Opioid Case Management - Provider Notification

paragraph.string: Prescription claims indicate your patient may have a history of opioid-related overdose or may be prescribed 90 morphine mg equivalents/day or more of opiates involving multiple prescribers and filled at one or more pharmacy (listed in Table 1 below). Your patient is also taking one or more CNS depressant opioid potentiator(s) (listed in Table 2 below). The FDA cited that the combination of opioids with CNS depressants has resulted in serious side effects, including slowed or difficult breathing, overdoses and deaths. The FDA found that CNS depressants were contributory to death in many cases where opioid analgesics were also implicated.

As part of a case management program with your patient’s insurance provider, when there is a history of opioid-related overdose or multiple prescribers are involved, our goal is to verify that there is a consensus among prescribers, and if not, to help facilitate one.

If you are prescribing opioids for this patient, please call us at 1-636-335-5397 or complete the 11 questions on this form and return it via fax to 1-833-263-1963.  If we do not hear from you, we will attempt to call you.  If we are unable to establish through communication with you that the current dosage of opiates is appropriate, medically necessary, and safe for your patient, we may have to inform the beneficiary and deny coverage of some or all of these medications.  Thank you for your assistance in addressing this matter.
If you are prescribing benzodiazepines and think that a limitation on benzodiazepine use would be appropriate for this patient, please call us at 1-636-335-5397.
1. Are you currently managing this patient’s pain regimen?
2. Does this patient have a diagnosis of cancer and is being treated for active cancer-related pain?
3. Is this patient currently in hospice, palliative care, or end of life care?
4. Does this patient have a diagnosis of sickle cell disease?
5. Is this patient currently in a long-term care facility or a facility for which frequently abused drugs are dispensed for residents through a contract with a single pharmacy?
6. Does this patient have a history of an opioid related overdose?
7. Do you have an opioid treatment agreement in place for this patient?
8. Are you aware that the patient is taking the opiates provided by the prescribers listed in the table below?
9. Will you continue to prescribe opiates for this patient?
10. Do you believe a patient-level opioid limitation through the patient’s insurance is necessary? (For example, the patient’s prescription insurance will only cover specified opioids and/or amounts)
____ Yes, I believe this patient is at risk of misusing their medication(s) and an opioid limitation IS necessary.
If yes, please call us, or we will reach out to you, to discuss implementing a patient level opioid limitation through the patient’s prescription drug benefit.
____ No, the medications detailed below are appropriate and an opioid limitation IS NOT necessary.

11. Do you believe a prescriber or pharmacy lock-in through the patient’s insurance is necessary?                               (For example, the patient’s prescription insurance will only cover opioids filled at a specified pharmacy and/or from a specified prescriber or prescribers)
____ Yes, I believe this patient is at risk of misusing their medication(s) and a lock-in IS necessary.
If yes, please call us, or we will reach out to you, to discuss implementing a prescriber or pharmacy lock-in through the patient’s prescription drug benefit.
____ No, the medications detailed below are appropriate and a lock-in IS NOT necessary.
To implement a medication change, please follow up with your patient. If needed, send a new prescription to your patient's dispensing pharmacy.
Information on this form is protected health information and subject to all privacy and security regulations under HIPAA.

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.
Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.
The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

English: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your {patient_sub_org_name} Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review call 1-866-575-3199

Don’t want to participate?

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at 1-866-575-3199 (TTY users should call 711), from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. EST, Monday through Friday. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain a {patient_sub_org_name} Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Sincerely,

{patient_sub_org_name}

paragraph.string: Because you are on an ACE inhibitor or an ARB, we have a program to help you take your medications correctly. This will help you to avoid harmful interactions and side effects. (Examples of these types of drugs are lisinopril or losartan.)

default.Spanish: Debido a que está tomando un inhibidor de la ACE o un ARB, tenemos un programa diseñado para ayudarle a tomar sus medicamentos correctamente. Esto le ayudará a evitar interacciones y efectos secundarios dañinos. (Ejemplos de estos medicamentos incluyen lisinopril o losartán.)

paragraph.string: Here’s how it works: You get to talk to one of our pharmacists to review your medications. You also receive tips and resources for managing your health. You will earn $25 once you complete the call.

default.Spanish: Así funciona: Podrá hablar con uno de nuestros farmacéuticos para revisar sus medicamentos. También recibirá consejos y recursos para manejar su salud. Ganará $25 tras completar la llamada.

paragraph.string: As a member of {hotline_name} Advantage, this program is offered to you at no cost. Call today.

default.Spanish: Como miembro de {hotline_name} Advantage, este programa se le ofrece sin costo alguno. Llame hoy mismo.

paragraph.string:
Call {hotline_name} at {hotline_phone} or toll-free 833-200-9561, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday through Friday. They’ll answer your questions and walk you through next steps.
They'll also set up a call for you with a pharmacist

default.Spanish: Llame a {hotline_name} al {hotline_phone} o al 833-200-9561, de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., lunes a viernes. Ellos responderán sus preguntas y le guiarán sobre los pasos. También programarán una llamada con un farmacéutico.

paragraph.string: Can I have a translator during this call?

default.Spanish: ¿Puedo tener un traductor durante esta llamada?

paragraph.string: Yes. Ask the pharmacist to have a translator on the call.

default.Spanish: Sí. Pídale al farmacéutico que incluya un traductor en la llamada.

paragraph.string: What is the reward and how do I earn it?

default.Spanish: ¿Cuál es la recompensa y cómo la obtengo?

paragraph.string: You can earn $25 when you talk to the pharmacist about your medication.

default.Spanish: Puede ganar $25 cuando hable con el farmacéutico sobre sus medicamentos.

paragraph.string: In addition, you can also earn an extra $50 if you speak to a pharmacist and are adherent to your ACE or ARB, select diabetes drugs, or statins.**

default.Spanish: Además, puede ganar $50 adicionales si habla con un farmacéutico y cumple con el tratamiento de su inhibidor de la ECA o ARB, medicamentos selectos para la diabetes o estatinas.**

paragraph.string: Rewards may take up to one month before they are available on your {hotline_name} Advantage CareCard. To learn more, call {hotline_name} Advantage at 888-712-3258. Our hours are October 1 – March 31, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., seven days a week, April 1 – September 30, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m., Monday through Friday.

default.Spanish: Las recompensas pueden tardar hasta un mes en estar disponibles en su {hotline_name} Advantage CareCard. Para obtener más información, llame a {hotline_name} Advantage al 888-712-3258. Nuestro horario es del 1 de octubre al 31 de marzo, de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m., los siete días de la semana, y del 1 de abril al 30 de septiembre, de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m., de lunes a viernes.

paragraph.string: **Adherence is defined as having 80% or more days that you have the medication on hand in a given time period.

default.Spanish: **La adherencia se define como tener el medicamento disponible el 80 % o más de los días durante un período de tiempo determinado.

default.Spanish: Para excluirse de este programa, llame al {hotline_phone} o al número gratuito 833-200-9561.

paragraph.string: Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiovascular Disease (SPC) is a Medicare Star Measure. We have reviewed our records and noticed that this patient is currently not taking a moderate to high intensity statin. The ACC/AHA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol recommends patients <75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to take high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. In patients >75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), it is reasonable to initiate a moderate to high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. This patient has a diagnosis indicating atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD).

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your ABC Health Plan, we would like to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider
Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used
Information regarding Safe Disposal of Prescription Medications

paragraph.string: To schedule your comprehensive medication review call {hotline_phone}

Don’t want to participate?

Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call Customer Service toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), or email us at mtm@abchealthplan.org, seven days a week from 8am-11pm EST. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an ABC Health Plan member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

We look forward to helping you live a healthier life.

Sincerely,

ABC Health Plan

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.
Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.
The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas- flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

paragraph.string: For additional information on the safe disposal of medications, please contact your local pharmacy, police department or visit: www.hhs.gov/opioids/prevention/safely-dispose-drugs/index.html

paragraph.string: The Oklahoma Health Care Authority (OHCA) is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Medication Therapy Management (MTM) Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific quality opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy can be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-405-876-7279.

All patients listed in this document have received a paid prescription with your national identification number (NPI) identified as the prescriber. Please be aware some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; however, additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our MTM Program’s toll-free number at 1-405-876-7279 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Rob Paterson, PharmD, BCPS
OHCA Medication Therapy Management Program

paragraph.string: Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® of Vermont is committed to ensuring our members receive seamless and highquality care. Our approach integrates the management of behavioral, pharmacy and physical health care benefits. We have implemented a Provider Outreach Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. As part of this program, drug utilization algorithms based on evidence-based guidelines are utilized to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

This letter has been generated because we have identified a member-specific opportunity. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if a change in therapy should be made.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and help reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-802-491-3297.

All patients listed in this document have received a prescription with your National Provider Identifier (NPI) number identified as the prescriber. Please be aware that some of these patients may have received a prescription from you at a different site of service, as this mailing is directed to the address primarily associated with your DEA.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data; additional claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please contact our tollfree number at 1-802-491-3297 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.

Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® of Vermont
bluecrossvt.org

paragraph.string:
Dear {patient_full_name},

As part of your {hotline_name} plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

default.Spanish:
Estimado {patient_full_name},

Como parte de su Plan {hotline_name}, nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro Programa de Gestión de Terapia de Medicamentos (Medication Therapy Management, MTM). Dado que cumple con los criterios del programa según la cantidad de medicamentos que se administra, la cantidad de afecciones médicas que padece y los costos anuales de sus medicamentos recetados, puede recibir los beneficios de este importante programa de forma automática. Participar no tiene ningún costo.
¿Qué puede hacer por usted el programa MTM?

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take
Provide guidance on topics to discuss with your provider

Spanish: Abordar cualquier pregunta o problema que tenga en relación con sus medicamentos.
Abordar cualquier inquietud que tenga, como problemas referentes a los costos, efectos secundarios o interacciones con otros medicamentos.
Brindar consejos sobre cómo obtener el máximo beneficio de los medicamentos que se administra.
Brindar orientación sobre determinados temas que puede analizar con su proveedor.

items: Access to a licensed pharmacist who will review all your prescription and over-the-counter medications
A To-Do List of the pharmacist’s recommendations to review with your provider
A Personal Medication List to track the medications you take and why they’re used

Spanish: Acceso a un farmacéutico con licencia que revisará todos sus medicamentos recetados y de venta libre.
Una lista de tareas pendientes que incluye las recomendaciones del farmacéutico respecto a lo que debe revisar con su proveedor.
Una lista de medicamentos personales para que lleve un registro de los medicamentos que se administra y los motivos de su administración.

Statin Therapy for Patients with Cardiovascular Disease (SPC) is a Medicare Star Measure. The ACC/AHA Guideline on the Management of Blood Cholesterol recommends patients ≤ 75 years of age with atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD) to take a high intensity statin to reduce cardiovascular risk, regardless of LDL level. Have this action plan with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other healthcare providers in your care team. Share this with your family or caregivers too.

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.

healthfirst.Chinese: 安全地儲存藥物並處理不再需要的藥物可以有效防止藥物傷害，也可預防藥物落入壞人之手。
healthfirst.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de forma segura y deshacerse de los que ya no necesita puede marcar la diferencia cuando se trata de prevenir lesiones por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos lleguen a las manos equivocadas.

default.Spanish: Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de manera segura:

healthfirst.Spanish: Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

English: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children can't see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

Chinese: 確保藥物儲存在原包裝容器內，並且蓋緊瓶蓋。
將藥物放置在安全的地方；切勿將藥物留在不安全的地方，例如廚房檯面。
將藥物存放在孩子看不見或摸不著的地方。
Spanish: Asegúrese de que sus medicamentos estén almacenados en su envase original y que la tapa esté bien cerrada.
Coloque sus medicamentos en un lugar seguro y nunca los deje en un lugar no seguro, como el mostrador de la cocina.
Guarde sus medicamentos fuera del alcance y la vista de los niños.

default.Spanish: Cómo deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura:

healthfirst.Spanish: Cómo desechar los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

Chinese: 儘快處理不再使用或過期的藥物。這會預防您與他人意外地使用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche lo más pronto posible los medicamentos que ya no usa o que han caducado. Esto evitará que usted y otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesita.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將藥物帶到在您附近的社區藥物回收服務點。
在將藥物帶到回收服務點前，請用馬克筆塗抹所有個人資訊，例如姓名或處方藥物號碼。在您社區中的兩個藥物回收服務點：
Spanish: La forma preferida de deshacerse de los medicamentos controlados que no se usaron es llevarlos a sitios comunitarios de devolución cercanos a usted.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, use un marcador para cubrir cualquier información personal, como su nombre o el número de receta. Dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad son:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

Chinese: 美國緝毒署 (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) 允許您使用藥房或其他藥物處理點提供的包裝，將未使用的處方藥郵寄回藥房或其他授權點。在郵寄未使用的藥物前，請聯絡您當地的 藥房。

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:
o       有關藥物回收的資訊: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收點: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

Chinese: 美國緝毒局（Drug Enforcement Administration，簡稱DEA）允許使用藥房或其他藥物處理服務點提供的包裝將未使用的處方藥物郵寄回藥房或其他授權服務點。在郵寄未使用藥物前，請聯絡您的當地藥房。

可在下列網站找到在您附近的其他藥物收集點以及藥物處理相關資訊：
o       藥物回收相關資訊：https://www.deatakeback.com
o       在您附近的其他回收服務點：https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración de Control de Drogas (DEA) de los Estados Unidos permite que los medicamentos recetados que no se utilicen se envíen por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para desechar medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos que no usó.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre la eliminación de medicamentos en los sitios web a continuación:
o       Información sobre la devolución de medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros lugares para devolver medicamentos cerca de usted: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

default.Spanish: Otras formas de deshacerse de los medicamentos:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

Chinese: 從原包裝容器中取出藥物，並將藥物與不受歡迎的物質（例如咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂）混合在一起。
將混合物放入能密封的容器中（例如拉鍊袋）以防藥物掉出。然後將原包裝容器扔進垃圾桶。
有些處方藥物可安全地扔到馬桶裡用水沖走。如要查看可扔到馬桶裡用水沖走的藥物列表，請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u>。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請詢問您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Saque los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con algo indeseable, como tierra, borra de café o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en un recipiente que pueda cerrar, como una bolsa con cierre zip-lock, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. A continuación, bote el recipiente en la basura.
Algunos medicamentos recetados se pueden desechar de forma segura en el inodoro. Para una lista de los medicamentos que puede desechar por el inodoro, visite:  <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u>.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit <font color='#3160BE'><u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u></font> for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

paragraph.string: Thank you for talking with me on {cmr_date} about your health and medications.

molina.Spanish: Gracias por hablar conmigo el {cmr_date} sobre su salud y sus medicamentos.

paragraph.string: {hotline_name} provides a Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program at no extra cost to you. As part of this program, pharmacists from {hotline_name} have reviewed your medication(s). Suggestions from the pharmacist are attached. These suggestions were made based on your recent prescription claims and do not include over-the-counter medicines, non-covered medicines, or samples.

molina.Spanish: {hotline_name} ofrece un programa de Administración de terapia con medicamentos (MTM) sin costo adicional para usted. Como parte de este programa, los farmacéuticos de {hotline_name} han revisado sus medicamentos. Se adjuntan las sugerencias del farmacéutico. Estas sugerencias se hicieron con base en sus reclamos por recetas médicas recientes y no incluyen medicamentos de venta libre, medicamentos no cubiertos ni muestras.

paragraph.string: This program will continue throughout the year. We may call you or mail you more information later in the year. If you are deaf or hard of hearing and have access to TTY, please call us at the number below to update your information.

molina.Spanish: Este programa continuará durante todo el año. Es posible que le llamemos por teléfono o que le enviemos más información más adelante en el año. Si usted es sordo o tiene problemas de audición y tiene acceso a TTY, llámenos al número que aparece a continuación para actualizar su información.

paragraph.string: We’re offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help Regence BlueShield of Idaho members like you improve your health. You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

We’re offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help Regence BlueCross BlueShield of Utah members like you improve your health. You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

We’re offering a medication management program at no extra cost to help Asuris Northwest Health members like you improve your health. You’ve been selected for this program to make sure you’re on the safest and most effective medicines for your health conditions. Our experienced pharmacists will help you achieve the following:

items:
BETTER HEALTH
A trained pharmacist will help you achieve the maximum benefit from your medicines by making sure you are on the right medicines for your specific health conditions.

INCREASED SAFETY
Some medicines may cause side effects or may not work well when taken incorrectly or with other medicines. The pharmacist will make sure you’re taking the right combination of medicines and provide tips on how to manage any side effects.

LOWER COSTS
The pharmacist can also look for ways to save you money by recommending lower cost options or removing any unnecessary medicines.

paragraph.string:
This letter includes your updated medication list and personalized action plan.
The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and how to use them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list every time you have a medication change and at every visit.
With every medication change, have your doctor send in a new prescription to your pharmacy.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.
