paragraph.string: Thank you for working with {hotline_name} to make sure your medicines are helping you feel better and are taken safely. We reviewed your medications on {review_date}.

This letter has your action plan (Medication Action Plan) and medication list (Personal Medication List). The action plan has steps you should take to help you get the best results from your medications. The medication list will help you keep track of your medications and make sure you take them the right way.

items: Have your action plan and medication list with you when you talk with your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers.
Ask your doctors, pharmacists, and other health care providers to update the action plan and medication list every time you have a medication change and at every visit.
With every medication change, have your doctor send in a new prescription to your pharmacy.
Take your medication list with you if you go to the hospital.
Give a copy of the action plan and medication list to your family or caregivers.

paragraph.string: If you want to talk about this letter or any of the other materials, you can call {hotline_name} member services at {hotline_phone} and ask for a pharmacist to call you back. We are available {hotline_hours}. From October 1-March 31, we are available 7 days a week, 8:00 am - 8:00 pm. We look forward to working with you to help you be as healthy as possible.
Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) Program

Aloha Care is committed to ensuring that our members receive integrated and high-quality care. As part of our Pharmacist and Physician Advanced Medication Review (AMR) program, drug utilization algorithms built on evidence-based guidelines were used to identify potential drug-related concerns, quality care gaps and other healthcare opportunities for your patients with Aloha Care health plan coverage.

Based on our records, we have identified quality opportunities for one or more patients under your care. Please review the information for each patient to determine if intervention is clinically appropriate, then, take steps, if necessary. A Aloha Care clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation to further review the identified opportunities and offer support.

The enclosed information is derived from pharmacy and medical claims data. Claims paid by cash or other insurance will not be listed. If you receive information that you believe to be inaccurate, please contact Aloha Care Pharmacy Services at 1-800- 535-9481 and destroy the inaccurate information in a confidential manner.

text.string: Aloha Care is an independent member of the Aloha Care Association L52000-W (1/20)

paragraph.string: SCAN partners with Arine to provide Medication Therapy Management services, and we are happy to inform you that you are eligible for a medication review with a pharmacist. We are offering you the opportunity to review your medications over the telephone with a pharmacist to help make sure you are on the right medications and receiving the best possible care. This service is free of charge. During the review, we will try to answer three main questions:

default.Chinese: SCAN 與 Arine 合作提供藥物治療管理服務，並且我們很高興地通知您，您符合由藥劑師為您執行藥物審查的資格。我們將為您提供一次藥物檢查機會，讓一位藥劑師透過電話對您的藥物進行檢查，以確保您目前服用的藥物適當，並獲得最佳護理。該服務免費提供。在檢查期間，我們將嘗試回答三個主要問題:
default.Spanish: SCAN se asocia con Arine para brindarle servicios para la administración de farmacoterapia, y nos complace informarle que es elegible para una revisión de medicamentos con un farmacéutico. Le ofrecemos la oportunidad de revisar sus medicamentos por teléfono con un farmacéutico para asegurarnos de que tome los medicamentos correctos y reciba la mejor atención posible. Este servicio no tiene costo alguno para usted. En la revisión, se intentarán contestar las siguientes tres preguntas principales:

items: Are you on the best medicines for your medical conditions?
Are the medicines being used correctly?
Are there options for your medicines which will save you money?

Chinese: 您目前是否正在服用最適合您病症的藥物?
用藥方式是否恰當?
是否存在能幫您省錢的替代藥物?
Spanish: ¿Está tomando los medicamentos más apropiados para sus afecciones médicas?
¿Está tomando los medicamentos de forma correcta?
¿Existen otros medicamentos con los que podría ahorrar dinero?

paragraph.string: After the medication review, we will mail you an updated medication list and a recommended to-do list. This information can be shared and used to help you when you talk to your doctors at your next visit. Your doctor will help you decide if our suggestions are right for you.

default.Chinese: 在藥物審查後，我們將向您郵寄更新的藥物清單和建議的待辦事項清單。如果您在下次就診時與您的醫生交談，可以分享這些資訊並用於向您提供幫助。您的醫生將幫助您確定我們的建議是否適合您。
default.English: After the medication review, we will mail you an updated medication list and a recommended to-do list. This information can be shared and used to help you when you talk to your doctors at your next visit. Your doctor will help you decide if our suggestions are right for you.
default.Spanish: Después de realizar una revisión de los medicamentos, le enviaremos por correo una lista de medicamentos actualizada y una lista de tareas recomendadas. Puede compartir esta información y usarla cuando hable con sus médicos en la próxima visita. Su médico le ayudará a decidir si nuestras sugerencias son adecuadas para usted.

paragraph.string:
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES
YOUR ACCESS TO CERTAIN PART D DRUGS WILL NOT BE LIMITED

After further review, we have decided that your access to these medications will NOT be limited under the drug management program. There are no changes to the way these medications are covered for you under our plan rules.
If you have questions about this notice or our drug management program to help enrollees use prescription opioid medications safely, contact us at:
If you have questions about your opioid pain medication or other prescription drugs you are taking, speak with your prescriber.

PRA Disclosure Statement According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995, no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless it displays a valid OMB control number. The valid OMB control number for this collection is 0938-1465. The time required to complete this information collection is estimated to average 5 minutes per response, including the time to review instructions, search existing data resources, and gather the data needed, and complete and review the information collection. If you have any comments concerning the accuracy of the time estimate(s) or suggestions for improving this form, please write to CMS, 7500 Security Boulevard, Attn: PRA Reports Clearance Officer, Baltimore, Maryland 21244-1850.

CMS does not discriminate in its programs and activities: To request this form in an accessible format (e.g., Braille, Large Print, Audio CD) contact your Medicare Drug Plan. If you need assistance contacting your plan, call: 1-800-MEDICARE.

paragraph.string: How to Safely Dispose of Unused Prescription Medications

Storing your medications safely and disposing of the ones you no longer need can make a difference when it comes to preventing medication injuries. It can also prevent medications from getting into the wrong hands.

default.Chinese: 請安全地存放藥物並處理掉您不再需要的藥物，這樣做不僅可以有效避免藥物傷害，還能防止藥物落入壞人之手。
default.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de manera segura y desechar los que ya no necesita puede hacer una diferencia en la prevención de lesiones causadas por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos caigan en las manos equivocadas.

healthfirst.Chinese: 安全地儲存藥物並處理不再需要的藥物可以有效防止藥物傷害，也可預防藥物落入壞人之手。
healthfirst.Spanish: Almacenar sus medicamentos de forma segura y deshacerse de los que ya no necesita puede marcar la diferencia cuando se trata de prevenir lesiones por medicamentos. También puede evitar que los medicamentos lleguen a las manos equivocadas.

default.Spanish: Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de manera segura:

healthfirst.Spanish: Cómo almacenar los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children cannot see or reach them.

English: Make sure your medications are stored in their original container and the cap is on tight.
Place your medications in a safe location and never leave it in an unsecured place, such as the kitchen counter.
Store your medications where children can't see or reach them.

Chinese: 確保您的藥物存放在原來的容器中，並且蓋緊了蓋子。
將藥物放在安全的地方，而切勿將其放在沒有安全保障的地方，如廚房櫃檯。
將藥物存放在兒童看不到或夠不著的地方。
Spanish: Conserve los medicamentos en sus envases originales con la tapa bien cerrada.
Coloque los medicamentos en un lugar seguro y no los deje nunca en un lugar que no sea seguro, como la encimera de la cocina.
Guarde los medicamentos en un sitio donde los niños no puedan verlos ni alcanzarlos.

Chinese: 確保藥物儲存在原包裝容器內，並且蓋緊瓶蓋。
將藥物放置在安全的地方；切勿將藥物留在不安全的地方，例如廚房檯面。
將藥物存放在孩子看不見或摸不著的地方。
Spanish: Asegúrese de que sus medicamentos estén almacenados en su envase original y que la tapa esté bien cerrada.
Coloque sus medicamentos en un lugar seguro y nunca los deje en un lugar no seguro, como el mostrador de la cocina.
Guarde sus medicamentos fuera del alcance y la vista de los niños.

default.Spanish: Cómo deshacerse de los medicamentos de forma segura:

healthfirst.Spanish: Cómo desechar los medicamentos de forma segura:

items: Dispose of medications you no longer use or are expired as soon as possible. This will prevent you and others from accidentally taking medications you no longer need.

Chinese: 盡快處理您不再使用或過期的藥物。這將防止您和其他人意外地服用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche los medicamentos que ya no usa o que están vencidos lo antes posible. Esto evitará que usted u otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesitan.

Chinese: 儘快處理不再使用或過期的藥物。這會預防您與他人意外地使用您不再需要的藥物。
Spanish: Deseche lo más pronto posible los medicamentos que ya no usa o que han caducado. Esto evitará que usted y otras personas tomen accidentalmente medicamentos que ya no necesita.

default.Spanish: Programas de devolución de medicamentos cerca de su domicilio:

items: The preferred way of disposing unused controlled medications is to bring them to community take-back sites near you.
Before bringing your medications to take-back sites, use a marker to cover any personal information, such as your name or prescription number. Two medication take-back sites in your community are:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將它們帶到您附近的社區回收點。
在將藥物帶到回收點之前，請使用記號筆塗抹掉任何個人資訊，例如您的姓名或處方號。您所在社區的兩個藥物回收點是:
Spanish: La mejor forma de desechar los medicamentos controlados sin usar es llevarlos a los sitios de devolución de la comunidad cerca de su domicilio.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, cubra con un marcador cualquier información personal, como su nombre o número de receta. Los siguientes son dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad:

Chinese: 處理未使用的受管制藥物的首選方式是將藥物帶到在您附近的社區藥物回收服務點。
在將藥物帶到回收服務點前，請用馬克筆塗抹所有個人資訊，例如姓名或處方藥物號碼。在您社區中的兩個藥物回收服務點：
Spanish: La forma preferida de deshacerse de los medicamentos controlados que no se usaron es llevarlos a sitios comunitarios de devolución cercanos a usted.

Antes de llevar sus medicamentos a los sitios de devolución, use un marcador para cubrir cualquier información personal, como su nombre o el número de receta. Dos sitios de devolución de medicamentos en su comunidad son:

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1

Chinese: 美國緝毒署 (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) 允許您使用藥房或其他藥物處理點提供的包裝，將未使用的處方藥郵寄回藥房或其他授權點。在郵寄未使用的藥物前，請聯絡您當地的 藥房。

您可在以下網站找到您所在地區的其他藥物收集點和有關藥物處理的資訊:
o       有關藥物回收的資訊: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       您附近的其他回收點: https://apps2.deadiversion.usdoj.gov/pubdispsearch/spring/main?execution=e2s1
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

Chinese: 美國緝毒局（Drug Enforcement Administration，簡稱DEA）允許使用藥房或其他藥物處理服務點提供的包裝將未使用的處方藥物郵寄回藥房或其他授權服務點。在郵寄未使用藥物前，請聯絡您的當地藥房。

可在下列網站找到在您附近的其他藥物收集點以及藥物處理相關資訊：
o       藥物回收相關資訊：https://www.deatakeback.com
o       在您附近的其他回收服務點：https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración de Control de Drogas (DEA) de los Estados Unidos permite que los medicamentos recetados que no se utilicen se envíen por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para desechar medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos que no usó.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre la eliminación de medicamentos en los sitios web a continuación:
o       Información sobre la devolución de medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros lugares para devolver medicamentos cerca de usted: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

English: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:
o       Information regarding drug take back: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Additional take-back sites near you: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x
Spanish: La Administración para el Control de Drogas (Drug Enforcement Administration, DEA) de los EE. UU. permite que los medicamentos con receta sin usar se devuelvan por correo a las farmacias u otros sitios autorizados utilizando paquetes disponibles en las farmacias u otros sitios para la eliminación de medicamentos. Comuníquese con su farmacia local antes de enviar por correo los medicamentos sin usar.

Puede encontrar otros sitios de recolección de medicamentos en su área e información sobre cómo desechar los medicamentos en los siguientes sitios web:
o       Información sobre la devolución de los medicamentos: https://www.deatakeback.com/
o       Otros sitios de devolución cerca de su domicilio: https://bit.ly/3guWP4x

items: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) allows unused prescription medications to be mailed back to pharmacies or other authorized sites using packages made available at pharmacies or other drug disposal sites. Contact your local pharmacy prior to mailing unused medications.

Other medication collection sites in your area and information about medication disposal may be found at the websites below:

default.Spanish: Otras formas de deshacerse de los medicamentos:

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

Chinese: 從原包裝容器中取出藥物，並將藥物與不受歡迎的物質（例如咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂）混合在一起。
將混合物放入能密封的容器中（例如拉鍊袋）以防藥物掉出。然後將原包裝容器扔進垃圾桶。
有些處方藥物可安全地扔到馬桶裡用水沖走。如要查看可扔到馬桶裡用水沖走的藥物列表，請瀏覽 <u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u>。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請詢問您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Saque los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con algo indeseable, como tierra, borra de café o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en un recipiente que pueda cerrar, como una bolsa con cierre zip-lock, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. A continuación, bote el recipiente en la basura.
Algunos medicamentos recetados se pueden desechar de forma segura en el inodoro. Para una lista de los medicamentos que puede desechar por el inodoro, visite:  <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u>.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

English: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.
Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2 for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en <u>https://bit.ly/3TmFnO2</u> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

items: Remove the medications from their original containers and mix them with something undesirable, such as used coffee grounds, dirt, or cat litter.
Put the mixture in something you can close, such as a zip-lock bag, to prevent the medicine from spilling out. Then throw the container in the trash.

Some prescription medications may be safely flushed. Please visit <font color='#3160BE'><u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u></font> for a list of flushable medications.
If you have any questions about your medications, ask your doctor or pharmacist.

Chinese: 從原來的容器中取出藥物，將其與不需要的東西混合，如用過的咖啡渣、泥土或貓砂。
將混合物放入可以封閉的容器(例如一個拉鏈袋)內，以防止藥物溢出。然後將容器扔進 垃圾桶。
某些處方藥可以安全地沖走。請瀏覽 <font color='#3160BE'><u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u></font> 查看可沖走的藥物清單。
如果您對藥物有任何疑問，請諮詢您的醫生或藥劑師。
Spanish: Retire los medicamentos de sus envases originales y mézclelos con alguna sustancia desagradable, como granos de café usados, tierra o arena sanitaria para gatos.
Coloque la mezcla en algún contenedor que pueda cerrar como una bolsa con cierre hermético, para evitar que el medicamento se derrame. Luego, tire el recipiente a la basura.

Algunos medicamentos recetados pueden desecharse por el inodoro de manera segura. Ingrese en link <font color='#3160BE'><u>https://www.fda.gov/drugs/disposal-unused-medicines-what-you-should-know/drug-disposal-fdas-flush-list-certain-medicines</u></font> para obtener un listado de los medicamentos que se pueden desechar por el inodoro.
Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre sus medicamentos, consulte a su médico o farmacéutico.

paragraph.string:
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
CENTERS FOR MEDICARE & MEDICAID SERVICES

This is important information about your Medicare Part D prescription drug coverage. Read this notice carefully. For help, please contact us. Please see methods to contact us on the last page under “For More Information and Help with This Notice.”
NOTICE OF INTENT TO LIMIT YOUR ACCESS TO CERTAIN PART D DRUGS

What Action Do We Intend to Take?
Based on information available at the time of our review, we intend to limit your drug access in the following way(s), unless you provide us with information that changes our decision within 30 days of this notice:

What Is a Drug Management Program?
[patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] has a drug management program to help you use prescription opioids safely. Opioids are a class of drugs that include pain relievers available legally by prescription, such as oxycodone (OxyContin®), hydrocodone (Vicodin®), codeine, morphine, and many others. Opioid pain medications can help with certain types of pain, but have serious risks like addiction, overdose, and death. These risks are increased when opioids are obtained from multiple prescribers or pharmacies; when opioids are taken with certain other medications like benzodiazepines (commonly used for anxiety and sleep); and/or when a person taking opioids has a recent history of opioid overdose. If we determine that your use of prescription opioids is not safe, we may limit your access to them or to other medications like benzodiazepines under our drug management program.

What If I Don’t Agree?
You have the right to give us any information you think is important to our decision about the safety of your medication use.
If you or your prescriber has information you would like us to consider, you can contact us at:

Phone Number: 1-636-335-5397
Fax Number: 1-833-263-1963
Address: 1 Express Way,
St. Louis, MO 63121

Note: We are not allowed to limit your access under the drug management program if you are being treated for cancer-related pain or have sickle cell disease, you’re in hospice or get palliative or end-of-life care, or you live in a long-term care facility. If any of these apply to you or you have any other information you would like us to consider, please contact us within the next 30 days. See options to contact us in the section For More Information and Help with This Notice below.

What Happens Next?
We will review any information you send us. We will also review any new information from your prescriber(s). After we make a decision about whether you are safely using your medications, we will send you another notice within 60 days. You will receive another notice if we decide you’re not at risk and will not limit your access to these drugs. You will also receive another notice if we decide you’re at risk and limit your access to these drugs. This notice will explain how you, your prescriber, or your representative can ask for an appeal and, if you choose to appeal, we will review your case and give you a decision. If we continue to deny any part of your request related to the limitations that apply to your access to medications, we will automatically send your case to an independent reviewer outside of our plan.

Note: If you change to a different Medicare drug plan, we can give your new plan information about  your case and any limitations we place on your drug access under our drug management program. Your new plan may place you in its drug management program as well.

Visit www.hhs.gov/opioids for information about State and Federal public health resources that can help you learn more about opioid medications and how to use them safely, including information about mental health services and other counseling services. Also visit Medicare’s webpage www.medicare.gov/coverage/pain-management for information about Medicare’s coverage of other pain treatments.
FOR MORE INFORMATION AND HELP WITH THIS NOTICE
For more information about the drug management program or any of the information in this notice, please contact [patient_org.report.reportPlanDisplayName] at:
You may also contact one of the organizations listed below for assistance.

items: 1-800-MEDICARE (1-800-633-4227), 24 hours, 7 days a week. TTY users:1-877-486-2048
Medicare Rights Center: 1-888-HMO-9050
State Health Insurance Program National Technical Assistance Center: 877-839-2675

paragraph.string: As part of your IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) Medicare plan, we’re pleased to welcome you into our Medication Therapy Management (MTM) program. Because you meet the program criteria based on the number of medications you take, the number of health conditions you have, and your annual prescription costs, you’ve automatically qualified for this important program. There is no cost to participate.

default.Chinese: 作為您 IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) Medicare 計劃的一部分，我們很高興歡迎您加入我們的 藥物治療管理 (Medication Therapy Management, MTM) 方案。基於您所服用的藥物數量、所患的 健康病症數量以及每年的處方費用，您符合該計劃的標準，所以您已自動具備參加這項重要計 劃的資格。參加計劃無需任何費用。
default.Spanish: Como parte de su plan de Medicare de IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP), nos complace darle la bienvenida a nuestro Programa de Administración del Tratamiento con Medicamentos (Medication Therapy Management, MTM). Debido a que cumple con los criterios relacionados con la cantidad de medicinas que toma, los problemas de salud que tiene y el costo anual de sus medicamentos, usted califica automáticamente para este importante programa. Participar no tiene costo.
default.Vietnamese: Là một phần của chương trình Medicare IEHP DualChoice (HMO D-SNP) của quý vị, chúng tôi vui mừng chào đón quý vị vào chương trình Quản lý Liệu pháp Thuốc (Medication Therapy Management, MTM) của chúng tôi. Vì quý vị đáp ứng các tiêu chí của chương trình dựa trên số lượng thuốc quý vị dùng, số lượng tình trạng sức khỏe quý vị có và chi phí thuốc theo toa hàng năm, quý vị đã tự động hội đủ điều kiện tham gia chương trình quan trọng này. Không mất phí tham gia.
MTM có thể làm gì cho quý vị?

items: Address any questions or problems you have about your medications
Address any concerns you have, such as cost issues, side effects or drug interactions
Provide advice on how to get the most benefit from the drugs you take

paragraph.string: Participation is optional. If you do not wish to participate, call IEHP’s Medication Therapy Management team toll-free at {hotline_phone} (TTY users should call 711), {hotline_hours}. You may continue to receive calls throughout the year until a formal request has been processed. If you remain an IEHP DualChoice Medicare member, you can rejoin the program at any time. You may be offered MTM services again next year if you continue to qualify for the program.

paragraph.string: Healthfirst is committed to ensuring our members receive integrated and high-quality care. We have implemented a Quality Improvement Program to collaborate and assist you in providing safe, appropriate, and cost-effective care to patients. The intent of this program is to identify any potential medication-related concerns.

You are receiving this letter because we have identified specific deprescribing opportunities for Healthfirst members under your care. The identified members appear to be taking medications that may be duplicative or potentially inappropriate based on their medical conditions. Please review the information at the top of each page and the corresponding patient list to determine if it is clinically appropriate to discontinue any of the medications. Please contact the patient as needed with further actions.

A clinical pharmacist may contact you to schedule a consultation and explain how the information can be used to support your prescribing decisions and reduce the risks of adverse effects. You may also request a personal consultation, provide feedback, or request additional data by contacting your dedicated pharmacist at 1-212-301-8728.

All enclosed information is derived from Healthfirst claims data. If you receive information you believe to be inaccurate, please call our toll-free number at 1-212-301-8728 and destroy the information in a confidential manner.
Thank you for your continued care of our members.

Daniel Halevy, M.D., FASN, CPC-A
Vice President, Senior Medical Director
Healthfirst Quality Improvement Program
